---
title: MAST vs ASSIST
---

## MAST vs ASSIST: A Comparative Look through Harmony Software

Comparative studies between different diagnostic instruments, such as the Michigan Alcoholism Screening Test (MAST) and the Alcohol, Smoking, and Substance Involvement Screening Test - Substance Use (ASSIST), are essential for psychological researchers. However, such a task requires an in-depth harmonisation process, which can be quite taxing and overly subjective. This is where Harmony software, a tool specifically designed for psychologists, can change the game in comparing MAST vs ASSIST.

## Compare the items in MAST and ASSIST

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#___In0sIHsicXVlc3Rpb25fdGV4dCI6ICJIYXZlIHlvdSBldmVyIGxvc3QgZnJpZW5kcyBiZWNhdXNlIG9mIHlvdXIgZHJpbmtpbmc___In0sIHsicXVlc3Rpb25fdGV4dCI6ICJIYXZlIHlvdSBldmVyIGJlZW4gYXJyZXN0ZWQgZm9yIGRydW5rIGRyaXZpbmcsIGRyaXZpbmcgd2hpbGUgaW50b3hpY2F0ZWQsIG9yIGRyaXZpbmcgdW5kZXIgdGhlIGluZmx1ZW5jZSBvZiBhbGNvaG9saWMgYmV2ZXJhZ2VzPyJ9LCB7InF1ZXN0aW9uX3RleHQiOiAiYS4gSG93IG1hbnkgdGltZXM_In0sIHsicXVlc3Rpb25fdGV4dCI6ICJBc2sgYWxsLCJ9LCB7InF1ZXN0aW9uX3RleHQiOiAiSGF2ZSB5b3UgZXZlciBiZWVuIGFycmVzdGVkLCBvciB0YWtlbiBpbnRvIGN1c3RvZHkgZXZlbiBmb3IgYSBmZXcgaG91cnMsIGJlY2F1c2Ugb2Ygb3RoZXIgZHJ1bmsgYmVoYXZpb3I__In1dfV0=" target="harmonyapp">Import just ASSIST into Harmony</a> - compare ASSIST with other instruments

The Harmony software leverages advanced natural language processing and generative AI models to aid researchers in harmonising questionnaire items. It can process and compare individual items from both the MAST and ASSIST, even if they are in different languages. Harmony provides a percentage match between each item, simplifying the process of determining overlaps or discrepancies, thus making the MAST vs ASSIST comparison a seamless preface for further studies.


{{< card heading="Try Harmony" copy="Compare MAST and ASSIST " url="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app" >}}

{{< youtube cEZppTBj1NI >}}




To comprehensively compare and analyze MAST vs ASSIST, Harmony invites psychologists to upload the appropriate instruments into its user-friendly web interface. By significantly reducing the time and effort required in the harmonisation process, Harmony allows researchers to focus on the more critical aspects of their work — interpreting results and discovering insights in comparative studies like MAST vs ASSIST.
